name: Chickpea Stuffed Poblano Peppers with Smoky Tomato Sauce. Vegan Glutenfree Recipe
description: Chickpea Stuffed Poblano Peppers with Smoky Tomato Sauce. Easy 30 minute meal. Indian fusion recipe. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free
recipeIngredient: 1/2  roasted red bell pepper (I used jarred)
1/2 tsp garam masala  (or chana masala spice blend or spice blend of choice)
1/4 tsp cayenne powder or to taste
1 15 oz can chickpeas or 1.5 cups cooked (divided. Use 1/4 cup in the sauce above.)
cilantro, paprika and lemon juice for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add all the ingredients under tomato sauce and blend to a smooth puree.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add all the ingredients under tomato sauce and blend to a smooth puree.

recipeInstructions.text: Take about 2 Tbsp of the tomato mixture and mix in the 1.25 cups of chickpeas. Add salt, cayenne, garam masala, cilantro and mash and mix. Taste and adjust salt and spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Take about 2 Tbsp of the tomato mixture and mix in the 1.25 cups of chickpeas. Add salt, cayenne, garam masala, cilantro and mash and mix. Taste and adjust salt and spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the poblanos or other peppers. Remove seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice the poblanos or other peppers. Remove seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the peppers with the chickpeas. Sprinkle a little cumin powder on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the peppers with the chickpeas. Sprinkle a little cumin powder on top.

recipeInstructions.text: for a crunchier filling. Add in a little breadcrumbs to the chickpea mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: for a crunchier filling. Add in a little breadcrumbs to the chickpea mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray or brush the peppers with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray or brush the peppers with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes or until the peppers start browning on the the edges. Bake time depends on the peppers used.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at pre-heated 400 degrees F / 200ºc for 20 minutes or until the peppers start browning on the the edges. Bake time depends on the peppers used.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, In a pan, add a tsp of oil and heat on medium.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, In a pan, add a tsp of oil and heat on medium.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tomato puree and bring to a boil. 3-4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the tomato puree and bring to a boil. 3-4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Lower the heat to low-medium and cook for another 6-7 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Taste and adjust salt and spice.
recipeInstructions.name: Lower the heat to low-medium and cook for another 6-7 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Taste and adjust salt and spice.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the peppers with a generous drizzle of the tomato sauce and a sprinkle of sweet paprika, cilantro and lemon juice.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the peppers with a generous drizzle of the tomato sauce and a sprinkle of sweet paprika, cilantro and lemon juice.

recipeInstructions.text: For Variations, use mashed potato or peas for the stuffing. Or mix then into the chickpea stuffing. Add finely chopped greens to the chickpea stuffing.
recipeInstructions.name: For Variations, use mashed potato or peas for the stuffing. Or mix then into the chickpea stuffing. Add finely chopped greens to the chickpea stuffing.
